caption:
The photograph depicts an elderly man seated at a cluttered desk within a dimly lit room. The man, who is bald with glasses, wears a grey sweater and dark trousers. His expression appears mildly serious as he gestures mid-speech towards someone or something off-camera.

The desk is overrun with papers, tools, and various items suggesting a workspace of either mechanical or creative nature. Visible objects include newspapers, a telephone, a helmet, and other unidentifiable items adding to the clutter. The lighting casts shadows and provides a gritty texture to the entire scene, emphasizing the man's face and hand in the foreground.

In the background, thereâ€™s a glimpse of a window allowing some natural light to seep in, casting light on what appears to be an outdoor scene blurred beyond clear visibility. The room's atmosphere is reminiscent of a workshop or office that sees frequent use, characterized by the disorderly yet functional arrangement of items across the workspace.
title: Walter Doheling, 72, proprietor of the only gas station and store in the small town of Surprise. Mr. Doheling, who flies his own plane, has lived in the town all his life.
